taskMan.util

Class TimeSpan

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.util.TimeSpan

  • public class TimeSpan
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a timeSpan object. A time span represents a duration.
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.time.LocalTime defaultWorkDayEnd 
      private static java.time.LocalTime defaultWorkDayStart 
      private int[] span 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimeSpan(int duration)
      Creates a TimeSpan object based on a duration in minutes.
      TimeSpan(int[] newSpan)
      Creates a TimeSpan object based on an integer array that holds years, months, days, hours and minutes in that order.
      TimeSpan(java.time.LocalDateTime time1, java.time.LocalDateTime time2)
      Construct a TimeSpan object from 2 LocalDateTime objects.

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan(java.time.LocalDateTime time1,
                java.time.LocalDateTime time2)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Construct a TimeSpan object from 2 LocalDateTime objects.
        Parameters:
        time1 - The first localDateTime object.
        time2 - The second localDateTime object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - An exception is thrown when a null pointer is shown

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan(int duration)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a TimeSpan object based on a duration in minutes.
        Parameters:
        duration - The number of minutes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative.

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan(int[] newSpan)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a TimeSpan object based on an integer array that holds years, months, days, hours and minutes in that order.
        Parameters:
        newSpan - an integer array representing the time span
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the integer array has the wrong dimensions (!= 5)

                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new TimeSpan object from a given deviation.

        Returns:
        An new TimeSpan object representing a acceptable span.

        Parameters:
        other - The TimeSpan to compare to.
        Returns:
        True if this span is longer. False if other == null

      • minus

        public TimeSpan minus(TimeSpan other)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getDifferenceWorkingMinutes

        public static int getDifferenceWorkingMinutes(java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                                              java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                                              java.time.LocalTime workDayStart,
                                              java.time.LocalTime workDayEnd)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the amount of working minutes between two timestamps. A working day is from 8 to 17 on weekdays.
        Parameters:
        startTime - | The given start time
        endTime - | The given end time
        workDayStart - | A timestamp to override the default workday start timestamp, null to use the default
        workDayEnd - | A timestamp to override the default workday end timestamp, null to use the default
        Returns:
        Returns the amount of working minutes between two timestamps
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws an exception when a null pointer is found in the timestamps

      • addSpanToLDT

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime addSpanToLDT(java.time.LocalDateTime offset,
                                                   TimeSpan span,
                                                   java.time.LocalTime workDayStart,
                                                   java.time.LocalTime workDayEnd)
        This method will add a duration (TimeSpan) to a timestamp and return the result. These calculations will be made based on working days and working hours.
        Parameters:
        offset - | The original timestamp
        span - | The duration that should be added
        workDayStart - | A timestamp to override the default workday start timestamp, null to use the default
        workDayEnd - | A timestamp to override the default workday end timestamp, null to use the default
        Returns:
        the new timestamp
